import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

source.42cbaf4a:
df["total_nights"] = df["stays_in_weekend_nights"] + df["stays_in_week_nights"]
plt.figure(figsize=(25,10))
sns.countplot(x= "total_nights", data = df)
plt.title('Total Nights Stayed')
plt.xlabel('Total Nights')
plt.ylabel('Number of Stays')
source.e0b0f649:
plt.figure(figsize=(20,5))
grouped_month = df.groupby("arrival_date_month")["hotel"].count()
months = grouped_month.index

sns.barplot(x=months, y=grouped_month)
plt.xlabel("Months")
plt.ylabel("Number of guests")
plt.show()
source.5e8597d2:
# Results
In this dataset, 
*     there are more city hotels than resort hotels.
*     more than 4000 reservations were cancelled.
*     guests like staying 2 or 3 nights mostly.
*     there is sharp decrease between 7 nights stay and 8 nights stay.
*     portugal is the most active country.
*     august is the most demanded month and january is the least.

I will continue, please vote and support. Thank you.
source.4bb76462:
# Data Cleaning
"Company", "Agent", "Country" and "Children" columns include empty rows.
In order to fill empty rows in "children" column, average value of the column was calculated and filled.

"Country" column was filled with "PRT", because it is the most common country in this dataset.

"Agent" and "Company" columns were deleted, because there are many empty rows.
